arm_group.description: A daily ration of 40 kcal/kg of body weight during 56 days
A daily ration of 40 kcal/kg of body weight during 56 days

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether an improved corn-soya blend (CSB+) and a
      new formulated ready-to-use supplementary food (RUSF) are effective in the treatment of
      moderate acute malnutrition in children.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Nutritional Products to Treat Moderate Acute Malnutrition

detailed_description.textblock:
Assuming the availability of some food in the household, the caregivers were instructed on
      how best to use the food they have and the quantity of supplementary food distributed was
      calculated to provide about 50% of child energy requirement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children aged 6-59 month

          -  Weight-for-height between -3 and -2 z-scores without edema

          -  Good appetite

          -  Stable clinical conditions

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Weight-for-Height Z-score < -3

          -  Presence of bilateral pitting edema

          -  Unstable clinical conditions

          -  Not showing appetite

intervention.description: On enrollment, children were examined by a pediatrician to assess their health status and they were de-wormed with one tablet of Mebendazole 500 mg.
intervention.intervention_name: A daily ration of 40 kcal/kg of body weight during 56 days

clinical_study.official_title: Using Indigenous Foods to Reduce Malnutrition in Children

overall_official.affiliation: Centre for Food and Nutrition Research, IMPM

primary_outcome.measure: Recovery rate of the children receiving CSB+ or RUSF

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
